entry.title: GOVERNOR SAYS RULING SHOWS PRESIDENT LACKS AUTHORITY TO DEPLOY OREGON NATIONAL GUARD
entry.summary: October 5, 2025 8:00 a.m. On Saturday, Governor Tina Kotek issued a response to the U.S. District Court Ruling made after the state argued that the President lacks authority to federalize the National Guard except for circumstances of invasion, rebellion, or when federal laws cannot otherwise be executed. Governor Kotek claims that none of those...

entry.title: DEMOCRATIC DELEGATION MEMBERS CONDEMN CANCELLATION OF GRANTS FOR ENERGY PROJECTS
entry.summary: Oct 5, 2025 7:40 a.m. On Friday, U.S. Congresswoman Val Hoyle alongside Senators Ron Wyden and Jeff Merkley and other Democratic members of the Oregon Congressional delegation issued a statement denouncing the Trump Administration’s cancellation of nearly $500 million in Department of Energy grants to support energy reliability, resilience, and efficiency projects in Oregon. entry.title: DESPAIN LAUNCHES CAMPAIGN FOR 4TH CONGRESSIONAL DISTRICT SEAT
entry.summary: October 5, 2025 6:40 a.m. Last week, Monique DeSpain launched her campaign for Congress in Oregon’s 4th District, setting up a rematch to unseat incumbent Val Hoyle in November 2026. DeSpain said, “I am proud to launch my campaign to serve as your Congresswoman for Oregon’s 4th Congressional District and to unseat corrupt career politician...

entry.summary: October 4, 2025 8:50 a.m. Roseburg Police cited a man for driving while suspended on Thursday. An RPD report said at 5:30 p.m. officers saw the 32-year-old driving in the 1600 block of Northwest Eden Street and knew he was suspended at the criminal level. entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE JAIL MAN FOR DRIVING WHILE SUSPENDED

An RPD report said at 9:40 p.m. an officer stopped the 32-year-old from Drain for a traffic violation in the 900 block of Northeast Klamath Avenue. entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE JAIL MAN FOR ALLEGED THEFT AT STORE
entry.summary: October 4, 2025 8:30 a.m. Roseburg Police jailed a man for an alleged theft at a store on Thursday. An RPD report said at 9:50 a.m. officers contacted the 40-year-old regarding the incident at a business in the 2500 block of Northwest Stewart Parkway. entry.title: 4TH ANNUAL BLOCKTOBER FEST HAPPENING ON SATURDAY
entry.summary: October 3, 2025 5:00 p.m. The 4th annual Blocktober Fest is happening on Saturday in downtown Roseburg. It will be a family-friendly celebration of community, music, food, and local culture. From 11:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m., Southeast Jackson Street and Southeast Main Street will transform into a vibrant area filled with live music, vendors, entertainment...

entry.title: Overseas National Guard soldiers return to Southern Oregon
entry.summary: Oct. 3, 2025 11:25 a.m. Nearly 200 Oregon National Guard Soldiers assigned to the 1st Battalion, 186th Infantry Regiment return home to Oregon on Friday after serving for a year overseas. The soldiers were mobilized in October 2024 and stationed in the Sinai Peninsula in Egypt as part of the Multinational Force and Observers mission....

entry.summary: Oct. 3, 2025 11:20 a.m. Roseburg Police arrested a man on drug charges at Gaddis Park on Thursday afternoon. RPD said officers contacted John Thomas James around 2 p.m. while he was allegedly in the middle of a drug deal. The arrest record said the 72-year-old was in possession of over an ounce of methamphetamine,...

entry.title: Man cited for chopping limbs off a tree at Stewart Park
entry.summary: Oct. 3, 2025 11:20 a.m. A Roseburg man was cited for using an axe to chop limbs off a tree on city property Thursday morning. entry.summary: Oct. 3, 2025 10:35 a.m. U.S. Representative Val Hoyle will host a telephone town hall to discuss what’s going on in Congress on Tuesday, Oct. 7. entry.title: Historic firearms and quilts exhibit opens at Douglas County Museum
entry.summary: Oct. 3, 2025 10:30 a.m. The Douglas County Museum of History and Natural History opened a limited-time exhibit this week in the Museum’s auditorium. The Historic Firearms and Antique Quilts exhibit features an array of weapons from the 18th, 19th and 20th centuries and displays the evolution of quilting beginning in the mid-1800s. The exhibit...

entry.summary: Oct. 3, 2025 10:15 a.m. Douglas County residents with unwanted TVs, computers, gaming devices and other electronics can recycle those items for free on Saturday, Oct. 18 at the Roseburg transfer station. entry.title: “Simply sublime”
entry.summary: We all remember our first date. Our first car — it barely ran. Some remember their first bike, their first day of middle school, and their first sip of wine.

entry.title: Geneva Academy expands, contained on one campus
entry.summary: For the past few years, Geneva Academy has been using its Kline Street Campus, inside Wellspring Church in Roseburg, to teach the fourth-12th grade students, while the younger students used classroom space at Hucrest Church of God.

entry.title: UACT turns stage play into a fundraising opportunity with original production "Snapped"
entry.summary: Every theater kids dreams of their chance to visit Broadway, arguably the heart and soul of American theater. For the Umpqua Actors Community Theatre's (UACT) youth actors, that dream will become a reality after the group's latest production, "Snapped."

entry.title: Rōzubāgo e yōkoso: Delegates from Kuki-Shi, Japan, arrive in Roseburg
entry.summary: In 1993, two cities nearly 5,000 miles apart came together under a common value: to learn from each other and celebrate both similarities and differences.

entry.title: Oregon Dept. of Education releases statewide assessment data
entry.summary: Oct. 2, 2025 11:05 a.m. The Oregon Department of Education released the statewide 2023-24 assessment results for K-12 students. The results show areas of progress statewide as well as with many Douglas County school districts. The assessment results are for English Language Arts (ELA), Mathematics and Science. Overall, school districts in Douglas County showed improvements...

entry.title: Fire Prevention Month promotes safe use of rechargeable batteries
entry.summary: Oct. 2, 2025 9:25 a.m. October is Fire Prevention Month and the Oregon State Fire Marshal and Oregon Fire Marshals Association are urging all residents to buy, use and recycle rechargeable batteries safely. The “Take Charge of Fire Safety” campaign warns Oregonians that rechargeable batteries can create serious fire risks if not used correctly. It...

entry.title: SMART Reading program seeks local volunteers

entry.title: UCC remembers deadly shooting with acts of service, moment of silence, 10 years later
entry.summary: WINCHESTER — Umpqua Community College's Chief Academic Officer Danielle Haskett greeted those gathered Wednesday around the memorial of the Oct. 1, 2015, deadly shooting at Umpqua Community College (UCC).

entry.title: Rep. Elmer and Rep. Skarlatos elected to House Republican leadership
entry.summary: Oct. 2, 2025 7:45 a.m. The Oregon House Republicans have chosen new leadership. Representative Lucetta Elmer, from McMinnville, was selected as the new House minority leader in a Wednesday night vote. Representative Alek Skarlatos from Winston was chosen as deputy leader. Elmer takes over for Rep. Christine Drazan, from Canby, who led the Caucus during...

entry.title: OED ready to provide help for federal workers impacted by shutdown
entry.summary: Oct. 2, 2025 7:35 a.m. The Oregon Unemployment Department announced Wednesday that employees impacted by the federal government shutdown can already begin applying for unemployment insurance benefits. entry.title: Roseburg VA Health Care System remains open despite shutdown
entry.summary: Oct. 2, 2025 7:35 a.m. With the recent federal government shutdown casting uncertainty on many things, the Roseburg VA Health Care System confirmed Wednesday that it remains open.
